New_Bedford.Bradford Smith Building: The Bradford Smith Building was a historic building at 1927-1941 Purchase Street in New Bedford, Massachusetts. It was a 3-1/2 story wood frame structure, with a double-gabled roof and a stone and brick foundation. It was built in 1887 by Bradford Smith, a retired employee of the Taunton-New Bedford Copper Company, and housed retail space on the first floor and apartments above.
